intro: Matelea ceratopetala, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a yellow throat. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Matelea ceratopetala is often cultivated for its striking blooms and is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
